data.name: Parse and Evaluate an Arithmetic Expression
data.description:
Write an algorithm that takes an arithmetic expression in the form of a string, and returns a numerical solution, rounded to five decimal places. The expression may contain addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. The evaluation must follow proper order of operation. The string will be structured as follows:

Spaces will separate all operators and numbers in the string argument. No whitespace will precede the initial number or follow the final number

Negative numbers will be represented by a leading ```"-"``` without a space (in example, negative five is represented as ```" -5 "```. Decimals may be present. Decimals will be led by a zero if there is no number in the ones place (example: ```0.123```)

Operators will be represented in string format as the standard character for the operator. ```" + "``` represents addition, ```" - "``` represents subtraction, ```" * "``` represents multiplication, and ```" / "``` represents division.

Therefore, a string will appear as the following:

```javascript 
"5 + 7 - 8 / 2.37 * -5 + 2"
```
(understood as "five plus seven minus eight divided by two point thirty seven multiplied by negative five plus two") and should return a numerical value of ```30.87764```

Simply allow for an error thrown on any argument that does not meet the string specifications (examples: ```parser(a) parser(200)``` etc

Academically correct order of operation involves evaluating the expression from left to right, first evaluating multiplication and division, simultaneously, as they appear from left to right, then evaluating addition and subtraction simultaneously, in the order they appear, once again from left to right.
